Based on the given context, the appropriate Bloom's Taxonomy classification for the task "do iran and afghanistan speak the same language" is **Understand**.

The context provided explains that Persian, also known as Farsi, is primarily spoken in Iran and Afghanistan (officially known as Dari since 1958). This information helps to understand that Iran and Afghanistan do not speak the same language, as they have distinct names for the language spoken in their respective countries.

The "Understand" category in Bloom's Taxonomy involves explaining ideas or concepts, which in this case is the explanation that Iran and Afghanistan, while both speaking a version of the Persian language, have different official names for the language spoken in their countries.

Your task is to classify tasks into Bloom's taxonomy. The classes and their description are provided below:
Remember: Recall facts and basic concepts.
[Examples]: define, duplicate, list, memorize, repeat, state

Understand: Explain ideas or concepts.
[Examples]: classify, describe, discuss, explain, identify, locate, recognize, report, select, translate

Apply: Use information in new situations.
[Examples]: execute, implement, solve, use, demonstrate, interpret, operate, schedule, sketch

Analyze: Draw connections among ideas.
[Examples]: differentiate, organize, relate, compare, contrast, distinguish, examine, experiment, question, test

Evaluate: Justify a stand or decision.
[Examples]: appraise, argue, defend, judge, select, support, value, critique, weigh

Create: Produce new or original work.
[Examples]: design, assemble, construct, conjecture, develop, formulate, author, investigate
Classify the following problem into the corresponding category of Bloom's taxonomy:
do iran and afghanistan speak the same language
Extract the answer from the following context:
Persian (/ˈpɜːrʒən, -ʃən/), also known by its endonym Farsi (فارسی fārsi (fɒːɾˈsiː) ( listen)), is one of the Western Iranian languages within the Indo-Iranian branch of the Indo-European language family. It is primarily spoken in Iran, Afghanistan (officially known as Dari since 1958), and Tajikistan (officially known as Tajiki since the Soviet era), and some other regions which historically were Persianate societies and considered part of Greater Iran. It is written in the Persian alphabet, a modified variant of the Arabic script, which itself evolved from the Aramaic alphabet.

Based on the information provided in the context, the task "do good samaritan laws protect those who help at an accident" can be classified into the "Understand" category of Bloom's taxonomy.

The context explains the purpose and key aspects of Good Samaritan laws, which offer legal protection to people who provide reasonable assistance to those who are injured or in distress. The task requires the understanding of these laws and their intended purpose, rather than simply recalling facts (Remember), applying the laws to a specific situation (Apply), analyzing the connections behind the laws (Analyze), evaluating the merits of the laws (Evaluate), or creating new laws (Create).

The examples provided for the "Understand" category, such as "describe, explain, identify, recognize", align with the task of understanding the concept and purpose of Good Samaritan laws.

Therefore, the appropriate classification for this task is Understand.

Your task is to classify tasks into Bloom's taxonomy. The classes and their description are provided below:
Remember: Recall facts and basic concepts.
[Examples]: define, duplicate, list, memorize, repeat, state

Understand: Explain ideas or concepts.
[Examples]: classify, describe, discuss, explain, identify, locate, recognize, report, select, translate

Apply: Use information in new situations.
[Examples]: execute, implement, solve, use, demonstrate, interpret, operate, schedule, sketch

Analyze: Draw connections among ideas.
[Examples]: differentiate, organize, relate, compare, contrast, distinguish, examine, experiment, question, test

Evaluate: Justify a stand or decision.
[Examples]: appraise, argue, defend, judge, select, support, value, critique, weigh

Create: Produce new or original work.
[Examples]: design, assemble, construct, conjecture, develop, formulate, author, investigate
Classify the following problem into the corresponding category of Bloom's taxonomy:
do good samaritan laws protect those who help at an accident
Extract the answer from the following context:
Good Samaritan laws offer legal protection to people who give reasonable assistance to those who are, or who they believe to be, injured, ill, in peril, or otherwise incapacitated. The protection is intended to reduce bystanders' hesitation to assist, for fear of being sued or prosecuted for unintentional injury or wrongful death. An example of such a law in common-law areas of Canada: a good Samaritan doctrine is a legal principle that prevents a rescuer who has voluntarily helped a victim in distress from being successfully sued for wrongdoing. Its purpose is to keep people from being reluctant to help a stranger in need for fear of legal repercussions should they make some mistake in treatment. By contrast, a duty to rescue law requires people to offer assistance and holds those who fail to do so liable.

Classify the following problem into the corresponding category of Bloom's taxonomy:
is confectionary sugar the same as powdered sugar
Extract the answer from the following context:
Powdered sugar, also called confectioners' sugar, icing sugar, and icing cake, is a finely ground sugar produced by milling granulated sugar into a powdered state. It usually contains a small amount of anti-caking agent to prevent clumping and improve flow. Although most often produced in a factory, powdered sugar can also be made by processing ordinary granulated sugar in a coffee grinder, or by crushing it by hand in a mortar and pestle.

Based on the given information, the task "is elder scrolls online the same as skyrim" can be classified under the "Analyze" category of Bloom's Taxonomy.

The provided context compares the similarities and differences between The Elder Scrolls Online and The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, which requires the user to draw connections between the two games and analyze their relationship. The key elements that indicate this is an "Analyze" task include:

- The events in The Elder Scrolls Online occur a millennium before those in Skyrim, suggesting a temporal difference.
- The game has a "broadly similar structure to Skyrim," implying some resemblance but also differences.
- The game has two separate conflicts progressing simultaneously, one with the fate of the world at stake and another for the imperial throne, which is different from the main storyline of Skyrim.
- The player character's role in The Elder Scrolls Online, where their soul has been stolen by the Daedric Prince Molag Bal, is distinct from the Dragonborn narrative in Skyrim.

Therefore, the task of comparing and contrasting The Elder Scrolls Online and Skyrim requires the user to analyze the connections and differences between the two games, which aligns with the "Analyze" category in Bloom's Taxonomy.

Classify the following problem into the corresponding category of Bloom's taxonomy:
is elder scrolls online the same as skyrim
Extract the answer from the following context:
As with other games in The Elder Scrolls series, the game is set on the continent of Tamriel. The events of the game occur a millennium before those of The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim and around 800 years before The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind and The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion. It has a broadly similar structure to Skyrim, with two separate conflicts progressing at the same time, one with the fate of the world in the balance, and one where the prize is supreme power on Tamriel. In The Elder Scrolls Online, the first struggle is against the Daedric Prince Molag Bal, who is attempting to meld the plane of Mundus with his realm of Coldharbour, and the second is to capture the vacant imperial throne, contested by three alliances of the mortal races. The player character has been sacrificed to Molag Bal, and Molag Bal has stolen their soul, the recovery of which is the primary game objective.

Classify the following problem into the corresponding category of Bloom's taxonomy:
is the federal court the same as the supreme court
Extract the answer from the following context:
The federal courts are composed of three levels of courts. The Supreme Court of the United States is the court of last resort. It is generally an appellate court that operates under discretionary review, which means that the Court can choose which cases to hear, by granting writs of certiorari. There is therefore generally no basic right of appeal that extends automatically all the way to the Supreme Court. In a few situations (like lawsuits between state governments or some cases between the federal government and a state) it sits as a court of original jurisdiction.

Classify the following problem into the corresponding category of Bloom's taxonomy:
is batman and robin a sequel to batman forever
Extract the answer from the following context:
With the box office success of Batman Forever in June 1995, Warner Bros. immediately commissioned a sequel. They hired director Joel Schumacher and writer Akiva Goldsman to reprise their duties the following August, and decided it was best to fast track production for a June 1997 target release date, which is a break from the usual 3-year gap between films. Schumacher wanted to homage both the broad camp style of the 1960s television series and the work of Dick Sprang. The storyline of Batman & Robin was conceived by Schumacher and Goldsman during pre-production on A Time to Kill. Portions of Mr. Freeze's back-story were based on the Batman: The Animated Series episode ``Heart of Ice'', written by Paul Dini.

Classify the following problem into the corresponding category of Bloom's taxonomy:
is a wolverine the same as a badger
Extract the answer from the following context:
Badgers are short-legged omnivores in the family Mustelidae, which also includes the otters, polecats, weasels, and wolverines. They belong to the caniform suborder of carnivoran mammals. The 11 species of badgers are grouped in three subfamilies: Melinae (Eurasian badgers), Mellivorinae (the honey badger or ratel), and Taxideinae (the American badger). The Asiatic stink badgers of the genus Mydaus were formerly included within Melinae (and thus Mustelidae), but recent genetic evidence indicates these are actually members of the skunk family, placing them in the taxonomic family Mephitidae.

will there be a green lantern 2 movie
Extract the answer from the following context:
Green Lantern was released on June 17, 2011, and received generally negative reviews; most criticized the film for its screenplay, inconsistent tone, choice and portrayal of villains, and its use of CGI, while some praised Reynolds' performance. Reynolds would later voice his dissatisfaction with the film. The film underperformed at the box office, grossing $219 million against a production budget of $200 million. Based on the context provided, the given problem "does the icc has jurisdiction in the united states" can be classified into the "Understand" category of Bloom's taxonomy.

The context suggests that the United States has concerns about the functioning and jurisdiction of the International Criminal Court (ICC), and the US is hesitant to become subject to its jurisdiction. The problem requires the understanding of the relationship between the ICC and the United States, which aligns with the "Understand" category of Bloom's taxonomy, where the task is to explain ideas or concepts.

The key phrases that indicate this classification are:
- "The United States should have the chance to observe and assess the functioning of the court"
- "before choosing to become subject to its jurisdiction"
- "I will not, and do not recommend that my successor, submit the treaty to the Senate for advice and consent until our fundamental concerns are satisfied"

These statements suggest the need to understand the jurisdiction and functioning of the ICC in relation to the United States, which corresponds to the "Understand" category of Bloom's taxonomy.

Now You See Me is a series of heist thriller film written by Ed Solomon, Boaz Yakin, and Edward Ricourt. They focus on the actions of a team of illusionists named ``The Four Horsemen'' who pull off near impossible heists. The series features an ensemble cast including Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo, Woody Harrelson, Isla Fisher, Dave Franco, Michael Caine, Lizzy Caplan, and Morgan Freeman. The first film was released in 2013, while the second was released in 2016, and a third film is currently in development and set to be released in 2019. The series has received mixed reviews from critics and audiences and grossed nearly $700 million worldwide.

Based on the provided context, the task of determining whether a penalty shoot-out goal counts towards the golden boot competition would be classified under the "Remember" category of Bloom's taxonomy.

The context clearly states that "Converted shoot-out penalties are not considered as goals scored by a player for the purposes of their individual records, or for 'golden boot' competitions." This is a factual information that the person needs to recall or remember.

The "Remember" category in Bloom's taxonomy involves the ability to recall or recognize facts, concepts, or information. In this case, the person needs to remember the rule that penalty shoot-out goals do not count towards the golden boot competition.

Therefore, the classification of this task would be "Remember".

Classify the following problem into the corresponding category of Bloom's taxonomy:
does a penalty shoot out goal count towards the golden boot
Extract the answer from the following context:
A shoot-out is usually considered for statistical purposes to be separate from the match which preceded it. In the case of a two-legged fixture, the two matches are still considered either as two draws or as one win and one loss; in the case of a single match, it is still considered as a draw. This contrasts with a fixture won in extra time, where the score at the end of normal time is superseded. Converted shoot-out penalties are not considered as goals scored by a player for the purposes of their individual records, or for ``golden boot'' competitions.

will there be a new season of cutthroat kitchen
Extract the answer from the following context:
Cutthroat Kitchen is a cooking show hosted by Alton Brown that aired on the Food Network from August 11, 2013 to July 19, 2017. It features four chefs competing in a three-round elimination cooking competition. The contestants face auctions in which they can purchase opportunities to sabotage one another. Each chef is given $25,000 at the start of the show; the person left standing keeps whatever money they have not spent in the auctions. The show ended on its fifteenth season in July 2017. The series shares some basic elements with other four-chef, three-round elimination-style competitions on Food Network including Chopped and Guy's Grocery Games. Numerous Cutthroat Kitchen contestants have competed on these shows.

The Boy in the Plastic Bubble is a 1976 American made-for-television drama film inspired by the lives of David Vetter and Ted DeVita, who lacked effective immune systems. It stars John Travolta, Glynnis O'Connor, Diana Hyland, Robert Reed, Ralph Bellamy & P.J. Soles. It was written by Douglas Day Stewart, executive produced by Aaron Spelling and Leonard Goldberg (who, at the time, produced Starsky and Hutch and Charlie's Angels), and directed by Randal Kleiser, who would work with Travolta again in Grease shortly after. The original music score was composed by Mark Snow. The theme song ``What Would They Say'' was written and sung by Paul Williams. William Howard Taft High School in Woodland Hills was used for filming.
